SEARCH
Module com.example.myuno
Package com.example.myuno.model.player

Interface Player

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractPlayer, HumanPlayer, IAPlayer
public interface Player extends Serializable
Represents a generic player in the UNO game.

This interface defines the core actions and properties that any player, whether human or AI, must implement within the game logic.

  • Method Details

    • playCard

      Card playCard(GameContext context)
      Plays a card based on the current game context.
      Parameters:
      context - the current GameContext of the match
      Returns:
      the Card played, or null if no valid card is played

    • addRandomCards

      void addRandomCards(int size)
      Adds a specified number of randomly generated cards to the player's deck.
      Parameters:
      size - the number of cards to add

    • getCard

      Card getCard()
      Retrieves a card from the player's hand.

      The behavior of this method may vary depending on the implementation.

      Returns:
      the selected Card, or null if not applicable

    • getDeck

      ArrayList<Card> getDeck()
      Retrieves the player's current hand.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing the player's cards

    • hasOneCard

      boolean hasOneCard()
      Determines if the player has exactly one card in hand.
      Returns:
      true if the player has one card; false otherwise

    • hasSingUno

      boolean hasSingUno()
      Checks whether the player has declared "UNO".
      Returns:
      true if the player has sung "UNO"; false otherwise

    • singUno

      void singUno(boolean hasSing)
      Sets the UNO declaration status for the player.
      Parameters:
      hasSing - true if the player has sung "UNO"; false otherwise
